src:
Million Day 2 novembre 2019: i numeri vincenti estratti oggi
02 Nov 2019, 18:49 by Redazione



Million Day 2 novembre 2019, torna l’appuntamento con il concorso che regala ai fortunati vincitori ricchi premi. Scopriamo allora se la dea bendata avrà “scelto” un nuovo fortunato milionario. Il concorso a premi giornaliero targato Lottomatica, lo ricordiamo, permette di vincere fino ad 1 milione di euro.
Ad oggi sono 81 i milionari premiati. L’ultima vincita risale a martedì 29 ottobre 2019, quando un giocatore di Ragusa si è aggiudicato l’ambitissimo premio.
Come ogni giorno il concorso si svolge alle ore 19 qui potrete seguire in tempo reale l’estrazione dei cinque numeri estratti. Il gioco si basa sull’estrazione di 5 numeri da 1 a 55. Si vince anche con 4, 3 o 2 numeri estratti. 
 Million Day oggi, sabato 2 novembre 2019, ecco i numeri vincenti Ecco i numeri vincenti di questa sera: 7  –  8  –  16  –  33  –  40

text:
Climate night 02 of Nov: Rains continue in Oaxaca and Veracruz
Torrential rains will continue in Oaxaca and Veracruz, while tropical wave No.48 advances to the coasts of Guerrero and Michoacán
02 Nov 2019, 18:58 by The Debate
Mexico.- During the night of November 2, it is predicted that the mass of cold air, associated with front No. 9, will reinforce front No. 8; which extends in the Gulf of Mexico and the Yucatan Peninsula. While the tropical wave No. 48 moves along the coasts of Guerrero and Michoacán.
Due to the effects of front No. 9, there will be clouds and rains in Veracruz and Oaxaca that will cause occasional rains. Similarly there will be rainfall in the states of: Tabasco, Puebla, Chiapas, Campeche, Tamaulipas, San Luis Potosí, Guerrero, Mexico City, State of Mexico, Morelos, Tlaxcala, Yucatán and Quintana Roo.




Possible “frosts” are forecast in the Sierra de la Mesa Norte and the Mesa Central. Also, there will be gusts of wind exceeding 60 kilometers per hour in the "North" and waves of one to two meters on the coast of Tamaulipas, Tabasco, Campeche and Yucatán.
A low pressure channel will cause rains in the western mother mountains, affecting the states of Nayarit, Jalisco, Colima and Michoacán.



November 3

Very heavy rains at intense punctures (75 to 150 liters per square meter): Veracruz, Oaxaca, Chiapas and Tabasco.
Heavy rain at very strong point (50 to 75 liters per square meter): Campeche.
Intervals of showers with heavy point rains (25 to 50 liters per square meter): Jalisco, Michoacán, Puebla, Yucatán and Quintana Roo.
Showers intervals (5.1 to 25 liters per square meter): Chihuahua, Durango, Sinaloa, Zacatecas, Nayarit, Colima, Guerrero, Morelos, State of Mexico and Tlaxcala.
Isolated showers (0.1 to 5.0 liters per square meter): Sonora, Tamaulipas, San Luis Potosí, Guanajuato, Hidalgo, Mexico City and Querétaro.

The rains will be accompanied by electric shocks, torn winds, hail fall, overflows of rivers and streams, landslides on slopes of mountainous areas and flooding in low areas.



Very strong "North" event causes high waves on the coast of Veracruz, Isthmus and Gulf of Tehuantepec, for the next 24 to 36 hours.
Minimum temperature forecast for November 03:

Minimum temperatures (-5 ° C to 0 ° C) and frost: Sierras de Baja California, Chihuahua, Coahuila and Durango.
Temperatures from 0 to 5 ° C: Sonoras, Nuevo León, Tamaulipas, San Luis Potosí, Zacatecas, Aguascalientes, Guanajuato, Querétaro, Michoacán, State of Mexico, Puebla, Hidalgo, Tlaxcala and Veracruz.
Forecast of maximum temperatures for tomorrow November 3, 2019:
Temperatures from 35 to 40 ° C: Zones of Sinaloa, Nayarit and Michoacán.




Wind forecast for tomorrow November 3, 2019:

“North” event with wind gusts over 80 km / h: Isthmus and Gulf of Tehuantepec, gusts of up to 70 km / h: Central and southern coast of Veracruz, and gusts greater than 40 km / h on the coast of Tabasco , Campeche and Yucatán.
Wind with gusts greater than 50 km / h: Areas of Chihuahua and Coahuila.
